title: How Harris-Walz camo hats toppled Trump’s MAGA caps to become a viral sensation
content: The Harris-Walz campaign spurred enthusiasm with a popular camouflage baseball hat, resulting in massive orders for New Jersey's Unionwear factory. This surge saw workers clocking 60-hour weeks and additional machines purchased. The hat symbolized Harris's resonance with voters, with over 100,000 sold primarily to women. Unionwear's domestic manufacturing contrasts with Trump's foreign-produced merchandise.
summary: The Harris-Walz campaign spurred enthusiasm with a popular camouflage baseball hat, resulting in massive orders for New Jersey's Unionwear factory. This surge saw workers clocking 60-hour weeks and additional machines purchased. The hat symbolized Harris's resonance with voters, with over 100,000 sold primarily to women. Unionwear's domestic manufacturing contrasts with Trump's foreign-produced merchandise.

title: Why Gen Z and Alpha are calling everything 'Ohio'—And it's not a compliment!
content: The term 'Ohio' has become a popular catchphrase among Gen Z and Gen Alpha, referring to anything strange or absurd. Originating from long-standing internet jokes about the state, the word now appears frequently on platforms like TikTok. The meme culture around Ohio, which began with viral YouTube videos in 2009, has significantly evolved over time.
summary: The term 'Ohio' has become a popular catchphrase among Gen Z and Gen Alpha, referring to anything strange or absurd. Originating from long-standing internet jokes about the state, the word now appears frequently on platforms like TikTok. The meme culture around Ohio, which began with viral YouTube videos in 2009, has significantly evolved over time.

title: James Carville says 'every family has...whatever' about Kennedy Jr on Bill Maher show
content: Democratic strategist James Carville fumbled and struggled to find the appropriate word to describe RFK Jr's support for Donald Trump in the election 2024. The strategist was on Real Time with Bill Maher yesterday after Kennedy Jr announced that he would withdraw his campaign and would support Donald Trump. "Well you know every family has a ... whatever. That guy is not weird. That boy ain't right. Okay? There's nothing wrong in being weird. But that boy is just not right. He just did something wrong," Carville said.
summary: Democratic strategist James Carville fumbled and struggled to find the appropriate word to describe RFK Jr's support for Donald Trump in the election 2024. The strategist was on Real Time with Bill Maher yesterday after Kennedy Jr announced that he would withdraw his campaign and would support Donald Trump. "Well you know every family has a ... whatever. That guy is not weird. That boy ain't right. Okay? There's nothing wrong in being weird. But that boy is just not right. He just did something wrong," Carville said.

title: Fauci tests positive for West Nile Virus, now recovering at home
content: Dr Anthony Fauci was hospitalized after testing positive for the West Nile virus and is now recovering at home. He spent six days in the hospital and now is on the way to full recovery. West Nile virus is a mosquito-borne illness causing fever, body ache, diarrhea and rash.
summary: Dr Anthony Fauci was hospitalized after testing positive for the West Nile virus and is now recovering at home. He spent six days in the hospital and now is on the way to full recovery. West Nile virus is a mosquito-borne illness causing fever, body ache, diarrhea and rash.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy confronts CNN's Van Jones who says 'I will apologize to your wife'. Here's what happened
content: Former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy ran into CNN's Van Jones at the DNC and their interaction went viral as Van Jones once called Vivek a demagogue and Vivek on a different program replied to Van with the F-word and it was the first time the two came face to face after the episode. Vivek paid a surprise visit to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on the final day. He said he was present at the DNC venue for a few hours and was conducting a few interviews.
summary: Former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy ran into CNN's Van Jones at the DNC and their interaction went viral as Van Jones once called Vivek a demagogue and Vivek on a different program replied to Van with the F-word and it was the first time the two came face to face after the episode. Vivek paid a surprise visit to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on the final day. He said he was present at the DNC venue for a few hours and was conducting a few interviews.

title: First prisoner exchange since Ukraine's offensive in Russia: 230 soldiers return home
content: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 115 prisoners each after mediation by the United Arab Emirates, marking the first swap since Ukraine's recent military operations in Russian territory. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy shared images of released soldiers, while the Russian defense ministry detailed the return of servicemen from the Kursk region. Both countries thanked the UAE for facilitating the exchange.
summary: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 115 prisoners each after mediation by the United Arab Emirates, marking the first swap since Ukraine's recent military operations in Russian territory. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy shared images of released soldiers, while the Russian defense ministry detailed the return of servicemen from the Kursk region. Both countries thanked the UAE for facilitating the exchange.

title: When RFK Jr explained what's wrong with his voice
content: Kennedy Jr's voice is affected by spasmodic dysphonia making it always trembling like he is on the verge of tears. This is not the only medical abnormality that he has. In 2010, Kennedy Jr experienced memory loss and mental fogginess which was attributed to a tumor which Kennedy later referred to as a dead parasite in his head. He said a worm got into his head, ate a portion and then died.
summary: Kennedy Jr's voice is affected by spasmodic dysphonia making it always trembling like he is on the verge of tears. This is not the only medical abnormality that he has. In 2010, Kennedy Jr experienced memory loss and mental fogginess which was attributed to a tumor which Kennedy later referred to as a dead parasite in his head. He said a worm got into his head, ate a portion and then died.

title: First 10,000 Mpox vaccines finally set to arrive in Africa after long delays
content: The first Mpox vaccines were expected to arrive in Africa next week as the virus continued to cause a severe outbreak. Africa faced significant delays in receiving vaccines, raising global health inequality debates. Despite the urgency, African countries struggled with bureaucratic obstacles. The arrival of vaccines brought questions on effective deployment, especially for children.
summary: The first Mpox vaccines were expected to arrive in Africa next week as the virus continued to cause a severe outbreak. Africa faced significant delays in receiving vaccines, raising global health inequality debates. Despite the urgency, African countries struggled with bureaucratic obstacles. The arrival of vaccines brought questions on effective deployment, especially for children.

title: Greta Thunberg joins protest at Norway gas plant
content: Protesters, including activist Greta Thunberg and Extinction Rebellion members, blockaded a gas and oil processing plant in southwest Norway. The blockade involved kayaks, motorboats, and activists on land hindering access to the Karsto plant, operated by Equinor. Despite the protest, Equinor confirmed the plant continued its usual operations as police addressed the situation.
summary: Protesters, including activist Greta Thunberg and Extinction Rebellion members, blockaded a gas and oil processing plant in southwest Norway. The blockade involved kayaks, motorboats, and activists on land hindering access to the Karsto plant, operated by Equinor. Despite the protest, Equinor confirmed the plant continued its usual operations as police addressed the situation.

title: Kamala faces a Kennedy wrinkle on road to Kamalot
content: In a surprising move, Robert Kennedy Jr, a notable independent candidate, suspended his presidential campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. Kennedy's support waned from 15 per cent to 5 per cent after Kamala Harris secured the Democratic nomination. The endorsement's impact on voter dynamics remains uncertain, though Harris's lead over Trump saw only a minor change of 0.2 per cent in one poll.
summary: In a surprising move, Robert Kennedy Jr, a notable independent candidate, suspended his presidential campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. Kennedy's support waned from 15 per cent to 5 per cent after Kamala Harris secured the Democratic nomination. The endorsement's impact on voter dynamics remains uncertain, though Harris's lead over Trump saw only a minor change of 0.2 per cent in one poll.

title: 'To be a hater as an adult...': Former American soccer player Brittany Mahomes's cryptic reply after getting trolled for liking Trump's Instagram post
content: Former soccer player Brittany Mahomes was caught in a social media storm after liking an Instagram post by Donald Trump detailing his 2024 GOP campaign platform. Facing backlash, especially given her biracial family, she responded strongly to her critics. Mahomes later removed her like and unfollowed Trump, following the ongoing controversy.
summary: Former soccer player Brittany Mahomes was caught in a social media storm after liking an Instagram post by Donald Trump detailing his 2024 GOP campaign platform. Facing backlash, especially given her biracial family, she responded strongly to her critics. Mahomes later removed her like and unfollowed Trump, following the ongoing controversy.

title: 'The smell of ... ': Japanese TV anchor loses job after criticising men body odour
content: Yuri Kawaguchi, a 29-year-old Tokyo news anchor and harassment prevention lecturer, was terminated after criticizing men's hygiene in a viral social media post. Despite apologizing, she faced severe backlash and lost her job. The incident spurred debate about gender expectations and societal norms in Japan, reflecting the challenges women face in a male-dominated society.
summary: Yuri Kawaguchi, a 29-year-old Tokyo news anchor and harassment prevention lecturer, was terminated after criticizing men's hygiene in a viral social media post. Despite apologizing, she faced severe backlash and lost her job. The incident spurred debate about gender expectations and societal norms in Japan, reflecting the challenges women face in a male-dominated society.

title: 33-year-old woman missing after flash flood in Grand Canyon National Park
content: Chenoa Nickerson, 33, from Gilbert, Arizona went missing after a flash flood in Grand Canyon National Park on Thursday. She was swept into Havasu Creek, and despite ongoing search and rescue efforts, remains unaccounted for. The National Park Service dispatched a rescue flight to assist stranded hikers, but Nickerson's whereabouts are still unknown.
summary: Chenoa Nickerson, 33, from Gilbert, Arizona went missing after a flash flood in Grand Canyon National Park on Thursday. She was swept into Havasu Creek, and despite ongoing search and rescue efforts, remains unaccounted for. The National Park Service dispatched a rescue flight to assist stranded hikers, but Nickerson's whereabouts are still unknown.

title: 'Told to say it was inclusive': Newsom’s joke about Harris' Democratic nomination sparks debate
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom humorously commented on Vice President Kamala Harris' nomination process, suggesting it was hastily conducted. This follows President Biden's decision not to seek re-election, endorsing Harris. Despite criticism of the process, Democratic leaders insisted it was fair. Newsom's playful remarks have ignited debate on social media over the transparency of the nomination.
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom humorously commented on Vice President Kamala Harris' nomination process, suggesting it was hastily conducted. This follows President Biden's decision not to seek re-election, endorsing Harris. Despite criticism of the process, Democratic leaders insisted it was fair. Newsom's playful remarks have ignited debate on social media over the transparency of the nomination.

title: Why King Charles want to evict Prince Andrew from Royal Lodge?
content: King Charles considered stopping funding for Prince Andrew's security at Royal Lodge due to rising maintenance costs. This could lead to Andrew's eviction unless he covers these expenses. There is speculation that Queen Camilla might use the Lodge if she outlives Charles. The decision has raised discussions among the royals at Balmoral Castle.
summary: King Charles considered stopping funding for Prince Andrew's security at Royal Lodge due to rising maintenance costs. This could lead to Andrew's eviction unless he covers these expenses. There is speculation that Queen Camilla might use the Lodge if she outlives Charles. The decision has raised discussions among the royals at Balmoral Castle.

title: Bodies of 28 pilgrims killed in Iran arrive in Pakistan
content: The bodies of 28 Pakistani pilgrims killed in a bus crash in central Iran were returned home. The accident occurred as they traveled to Iraq for the Arbaeen commemoration. The bus overturned and caught fire due to a brake failure on a steep road. Injured survivors were hospitalized in Karachi.
summary: The bodies of 28 Pakistani pilgrims killed in a bus crash in central Iran were returned home. The accident occurred as they traveled to Iraq for the Arbaeen commemoration. The bus overturned and caught fire due to a brake failure on a steep road. Injured survivors were hospitalized in Karachi.

title: Tusk says he doesn't have the votes in parliament to liberalise Poland's strict abortion law
content: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk admitted that his government lacks parliamentary support to amend the nation's strict abortion laws and fulfil his promise to legalize abortion up to the 12th week. Tusk stated efforts are ongoing to ease current restrictions through new procedures in the prosecutor's office and hospitals, despite resistance from conservative lawmakers.
summary: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk admitted that his government lacks parliamentary support to amend the nation's strict abortion laws and fulfil his promise to legalize abortion up to the 12th week. Tusk stated efforts are ongoing to ease current restrictions through new procedures in the prosecutor's office and hospitals, despite resistance from conservative lawmakers.

title: 20 abducted Nigerian medical students freed
content: Twenty Nigerian medical students who were kidnapped on August 15 while traveling to a convention in Benue state have been released after more than a week in captivity, according to police. Details of their release remain undisclosed. The abduction adds to the growing number of ransom kidnappings in Nigeria. The Nigerian Medical Students Association confirmed their safety.
summary: Twenty Nigerian medical students who were kidnapped on August 15 while traveling to a convention in Benue state have been released after more than a week in captivity, according to police. Details of their release remain undisclosed. The abduction adds to the growing number of ransom kidnappings in Nigeria. The Nigerian Medical Students Association confirmed their safety.

title: Russia again declares emergency in Voronezh after Ukrainian drone attacks
content: Ukraine's overnight drone attack led Russia to declare a state of emergency in Voronezh. Russian forces intercepted five drones, causing debris-induced fires and detonation of explosive materials. Authorities imposed emergency measures and evacuated 200 people in the Ostrogozhsky district. No casualties were reported, but risks remain as drone warfare continues between the two nations.
summary: Ukraine's overnight drone attack led Russia to declare a state of emergency in Voronezh. Russian forces intercepted five drones, causing debris-induced fires and detonation of explosive materials. Authorities imposed emergency measures and evacuated 200 people in the Ostrogozhsky district. No casualties were reported, but risks remain as drone warfare continues between the two nations.

title: Breonna Taylor Case: Judge dismisses major charges against officers, accuses boyfriend for death
content: A federal judge dismissed felony charges against two former Louisville officers involved in falsifying a warrant that led to Breonna Taylor's death. The judge ruled that Taylor's boyfriend, Kenneth Walker, who fired at police during the raid, was the legal cause of her death. Some charges against the officers remain, and the case is undergoing further review.
summary: A federal judge dismissed felony charges against two former Louisville officers involved in falsifying a warrant that led to Breonna Taylor's death. The judge ruled that Taylor's boyfriend, Kenneth Walker, who fired at police during the raid, was the legal cause of her death. Some charges against the officers remain, and the case is undergoing further review.
